definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
surname Mi/name of an ancient state

sentences.english: You’re building a 12)rat ship here, a vessel for sea-going snitches.
sentences.chinese: 你們在營造一艘耗子船，一艘告密者的大船。

sentences.english: Any one of our employees could be the informer .
sentences.chinese: 我們的任何一位僱員都有可能成爲告密者。

sentences.english: Telling an adult is not snitching.
You're building a rat ship here. A vessel for sea going snitches.
sentences.chinese: 你正在這裏營造一艘小人船，一艘告密者的大船。

sentences.english: Any one of our employees could be the informer.
sentences.chinese: 咱們的任罕救嘶位僱員都域許成爲告密者。

sentences.english: Thanks for a nation of finks.
sentences.chinese: 感謝一個全是告密者的國度。

sentences.english: He ratted out his best friend to the police.
sentences.chinese: 他向警方告密，出賣了他最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Police said an informant led narcotics officers to the house.
sentences.chinese: 警方說是一名告密者把緝毒警察引領到此的。

sentences.english: They place animal informants throughout the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他們在整個森林佈置動物告密者。

sentences.english: Then the informers pointed to the grass.
What provides anonymity for the whistleblower?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼爲告密者提供匿名性？

sentences.english: In the past, I have overlooked Danielle's underhanded behavior in order to save our friendship.
sentences.chinese: 過去，爲了挽救我們的友誼，我原諒丹尼爾告密行爲。

sentences.english: The informer betrayed them to the police.
sentences.chinese: 告密者把他們出賣給了警察。

sentences.english: The gang leader decided that the informer must be taken for a ride.
sentences.chinese: 歹徒頭目決定要將告密者用汽車綁架去幹掉。

sentences.english: Nick:It's really not fair that Samsung was not fined because they became informers.
sentences.chinese: 真不公平，三星公司竟然因爲先告密而逃過被罰款。

sentences.english: I am convinced the other captives are flunkies and maybe snitches.
sentences.chinese: 我確信其它俘虜都是狗腿子或告密者。

definition: to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to report (an offense to the authorities)/to inform against sb
to tell on sb/to complain (to a teacher, a superior etc)/to bring a lawsuit
to frame/to bring false charges against
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
